Can effectively _pierce through blocks_, detonating inside protected structures.
block.createbigcannons.ap_shot.tooltip.s: Can effectively _pierce through blocks_. Good against _armored targets_. _Cannot be fuzed and detonated._
Contains _grapeshot_, which can damage soft blocks such as _wood_.
block.createbigcannons.big_cartridge.too: _Compact_ big cannon propellant that can be filled with _various levels_ of more _powerful propellant_. _Can only be used once_ in a shot, but can be _refilled_ afterwards.
block.createbigcannons.cannon.tooltip.br: Cannons built with this as the closing can safely handle up to _%s Powder Charge(s)_ or equivalent.
block.createbigcannons.cannon_carriage.t: Changes the rate of fire of a mounted autocannon if present.
Assembles or disassembles the carriage. The carriage does not need to have a cannon mounted.
_Fires cannon_ on carriage if present. _Repeatedly fires cannon_ if possible.
The forward/backward keys _set pitch_ instead of moving the cannon.
_Mobile_ cannon mount. Can be _moved around_, but _cannot be automated_ like the Cannon Mount.
block.createbigcannons.fluid_shell.toolt: The shell can only be filled through _the same face that the fuze is placed on._ If a fuze is present, the shell _cannot be filled._
Some fluids may not have any effect on release. Supported fluids include, but may not be limited to, _water, lava, and liquid potions._
Spreads the contained fluid all over the targeted area, with _different effects depending on the fluid_.
Explodes with a bit more power than _TNT_.
This block requires the following parts:
block.createbigcannons.incomplete_cast_i: Incomplete Cast Iron Autocannon Recoil Spring
block.createbigcannons.mortar_stone.tool: This mortar stone can handle up to _%s Powder Charges_ (or equivalent) before breaking.

Powerful stone that _explodes on impact._ _Flies further_ than other projectiles. Good for attacking _walls and fortifications._ _Cannot be fuzed and detonated._ Will _break_ if too many Powder Charges are used.
block.createbigcannons.shrapnel_shell.to: Releases _shrapnel_ in its direction. The shrapnel _spreads out over a wide area._
Peppers the battlefield with _shrapnel bullets_ when detonated.
block.createbigcannons.solid_shot.toolti: _High penetrating force._ Best suited for _soft targets_ such as _wooden structures and thin walls_. _Cannot be fuzed and detonated._
block.createbigcannons.unbored_cast_iron: Unbored Cast Iron Autocannon Recoil Spring
block.createbigcannons.unbored_very_larg: Unbored Very Large Nethersteel Cannon Layer
Unbored Very Large Steel Cannon Layer
block.createbigcannons.unbored_very_smal: Unbored Very Small Nethersteel Cannon Layer
Unbored Very Small Steel Cannon Layer
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_crafting/: Using the Basin Foundry Lid
Basin Foundry Lids are used to melt down metals for cannon casting.
They must be heated to process melting recipes.
Boring Holes in Cast Cannons
Cannon Drills are used to bore out cast cannons.
In addition to rotational force, they require water to operate, and consume more as they speed up.
The speed of the drill must match the speed of the lathe to do work.
Bored cannon blocks drop scrap items.
Building Built-Up Cannons
Cannon Builders are used to put together the layers of built-up cannons.
Pulse the Cannon Builder with power to toggle its attachment state.
When grabbing layers from built-up blocks, the outermost layer will always be grabbed
Cannon Casting
Cannon Casts are the first block recipe for cannon blocks.
It is possible to automate the removal of finished casts.
Smaller cannons such as autocannons shed the casting sand automatically.
Use a cannon mould to build a cast layer.
Deployers can also interact with cannon casts.
Fill the cast with molten metal to start the casting process.
Cannon casts output a signal that can be read by comparators.
They output a signal from 0 to 14 measuring how full the cast is, and 15 when the cast is finished.
After being completely filled up, the cannon cast takes some time to solidify.
The time it takes for the casting process to finish depends on the size of the cast.
The finished cannon cast can be removed by breaking or interacting with it.
Finishing Built-Up Cannons
Blasting built-up cannon layers turns them into built-up cannon blocks.
The process works similar to bulk blasting of items, using a fan blowing into a lava block to produce a heating current.
It takes a while for the cannon layers to transform into cannon blocks.
Incomplete Cannon Blocks
Some bored cannon blocks need additional items to be completed.
These are usually cannon breech blocks.
Use the listed items on the block to complete it.
Deployers can also complete incomplete cannon blocks.
Creating a Quick-Firing Breech
Use a Quick-Firing Mechanism to convert a Sliding Breech into a Quick-Firing Breech.
Deployers can also be used to create Quick-Firing Breeches.
Wrench a Quick-Firing Breech to revert it back to a Sliding Breech.
Moving Cannons Around
By default, cast cannons will turn into scrap when broken, even if broken with Silk Touch.
Create's contraptions can be used in varying ways to move cannons.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_kinetics/: Mechanical Arms can be used to reload the Quick-Firing Breech.
Right-click the Cannon Mount to set the arm's output.
The Quick-Firing Breech allows fast reloading of assembled big cannons.
The Quick-Firing Breech can be opened and closed by right clicking the side of the breech.
First, load the projectile by right clicking the open side of the breech.
Then load the propellant and close the breech.
Big Cartridges are recommended for faster reloading.
The big cannon can then be fired.
Remaining munitions such as spent Big Cartridge cases will be automatically ejected.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_loader/ha: Handloading tools are convenient for loading big cannons.
Munitions can also be inserted directly into assembled big cannons.
Handloading tools can also interact with assembled big cannons.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_loader/lo: Cannon Loaders work like Mechanical Pistons, using Piston Extension Poles to extend their range.
They must be outfitted with a head to be useful, such as a Ram Head or a Worm Head.
Under normal circumstances, the Ram Head should be used.
However, the Worm Head can be attached if the cannon needs to be unjammed.
Before reloading a cannon, it must be disassembled.
When loading a cannon, the loader mechanism, munitions, and cannon must all be in line on the same axis.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_mount/ass: Big cannons need to be placed on cannon mounts to be assembled.
To assemble a cannon, power the hammer face with a redstone signal.
Power the Cannon Mount to aim the cannon up and down.
A Yaw Controller is needed to aim the cannon left and right.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_mount/cus: Autocannons can be customized in a few ways, both cosmetic and functional.
Wrenching the end of an autocannon will change the type of barrel end.
Recoil Springs make the barrel push back when firing.
Wrenching the autocannon breech will add handles.
Autocannons with handles are controlled by the player instead of by kinetics.
You can place a seat on the handle breech.
Wrenching the autocannon breech again will remove handles.
Any placed seats will be returned to the player or popped off.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_mount/fir: After loading, assembling, and aiming the cannon, big cannons are ready to fire.
Power the lit cannon face on the cannon mount to fire the mounted cannon.
To disassemble the cannon to prepare it for the next shot, unpower the hammer face.
The cannon instantly snaps back to the position it was assembled at when disassembled.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_mount/scr: Screw Breeches are strong breech blocks that do not suffer strength penalties unlike Sliding Breeches.
Use rotational force to unlock screw breeches.
Once the screw breech is fully unlocked, use kinetic contraptions to move it out of the way for loading.
Once loading is finished, close the screw breech to close the cannon.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_mount/sli: Sliding Breeches offer a quick way to load cannons from the breech, at the cost of cannon strength.
Use rotational force to open up sliding breeches.
Once the sliding breech is fully opened, cannon munitions can be loaded through the breech.
The sliding breech must be not obstructed by munitions or loader contraptions for it to close.
createbigcannons.ponder.cannon_mount/usi: Autocannons fire at a fast rate.
They take in item munitions as input.
The Yaw Controller does not accept input.
Power the firing face on the Cannon Mount to make the autocannon shoot.
Increasing the power on the firing face increases the fire rate of the autocannon.
createbigcannons.ponder.munitions/automa: Automating loading the Autocannon Ammo Container
Mechanical Arms can load assembled autocannons with Autocannon Ammo Containers.
Set a Cannon Mount with an autocannon as one of the Mechanical Arm's deposits.
You can dispose of empty containers by setting a deposit filter slot to an empty container.
createbigcannons.ponder.munitions/cannon: When loading a cannon, care must be taken to ensure that cannon loads are safe and effective.
...allowing a fired projectile to collide with another object in the barrel...
...can cause catastrophic failure and pose a major threat to the surrounding environment.
A cannon's material has two factors that can cause the cannon to fail; its squib ratio and its strength.
The squib ratio determines the minimum length of barrel per Powder Charge a projectile can safely travel through before possibly getting stuck.
For example, the squib ratio of cast iron is 1 barrel to 1 Powder Charge.
The barrel that the loaded projectile is in is also counted towards the distance travelled.
The strength of a cannon determines the maximum amount of Powder Charges that can be loaded, after which the cannon has a chance to burst when firing.
For example, cast iron is strong enough to safely handle 2 Powder Charges.
...such as not loading enough Powder Charges...
createbigcannons.ponder.munitions/fillin: Autocannon Ammo Containers can be filled in-menu.
You can also configure tracer spacing in the menu.
Different ammo types have different capacities.
The container can also be filled with deployers.
Ammo with tracers will go in the tracer slot, otherwise it will go in the main slot.
createbigcannons.ponder.munitions/fuzing: Fuzes can be attached to certain projectiles to detonate them under certain conditions.
Right-click the projectile head with an empty hand to remove any fuzes present.
Fuzing projectiles can be automated with Deployers.
createbigcannons.ponder.munitions/using_: Autocannon Ammo Containers are a convenient way to store autocannon ammo and to load autocannons.
Right-click a container on an Autocannon Breech to load it.
To remove a container, right-click the breech with an empty hand.
You can also swap out the container by right-clicking the breech with another container.
You can also load an assembled autocannon with a container.
However, you can only remove a present container on an assembled autocannon if it is empty, or by swapping or shift right-clicking it.
createbigcannons.ponder.tag.munitions.de: Blocks that make up cannon loads, and what they can do
createbigcannons.ponder.tag.operating_ca: How to use big cannons safely and effectively
death.attack.createbigcannons.big_cannon: %s was directly killed by a large caliber round
death.attack.createbigcannons.machine_gu: %s was punctured by machine gun fire
%s was filled with holes by machine gun fire and the sea round them turned pink
The cannon drill requires water to operate
The cannon drill has encountered a problem:
The cannon drill did not fail, this should not be displaying
The cannon drill must be operating at the same RPM or faster as the target lathe
Cannon assembly area at [%s, %s, %s] is out of bounds
Cannon block at [%s, %s, %s] contains a cannon loader part
Cannon is longer than the maximum length of %s
Cannon block at [%s, %s, %s] has not finished the crafting process
A cannon must have one and only one opening and one and only one closed end
This cannon requires an autocannon breech to fire
item.createbigcannons.ap_autocannon_roun: _Strong penetrating force._ Best suited for _soft targets_ such as _wooden structures and thin armor._ _Cannot be fuzed and detonated._
item.createbigcannons.cannon_crafting_wa: Use on various cannon crafting processes such as _casting, boring, assembly,_ and _heating_ to _instantly finish_ the process.
item.createbigcannons.delayed_impact_fuz: Opens the _Set Delayed Impact Fuze_ menu, where the fuze duration can be set.
The fuze detonates after the set time from when the projectile impacts.
Upon impact this fuze has a _%s%%_ chance to start ticking.
Detonates a _short time_ after _hitting_ something. Due to its _simple trigger mechanism_, it does not always trigger the timer.
item.createbigcannons.flak_autocannon_ro: Releases _shrapnel_ in its direction. The shrapnel _spreads out over a wide area._
Can be used to shoot out _airborne targets._ Peppers targets with _shrapnel._
item.createbigcannons.impact_fuze.toolti: Upon impact this fuze has a _%s%%_ chance to detonate.
Detonates when the projectile _hits something_. Due to its _simplicity_, it does not always detonate on impact.
_Cheaper_ autocannon ammunition that is more effective against _entities._
item.createbigcannons.partial_cast_iron_: Partial Cast Iron Autocannon Breech Extractor
item.createbigcannons.proximity_fuze.too: Opens the _Set Proximity Fuze_ menu, where the detonation distance can be set.
The fuze detonates after the projectile gets is within the set range of a block.
Detonates when it _gets close_ to a block.
item.createbigcannons.ram_rod.tooltip.ac: Pushes munition blocks further into the cannon. Can push munition blocks out if applicable.
Pushes munition blocks. A string of munition blocks _must be connected to a valid cannon block_ to be pushed.
item.createbigcannons.ram_rod.tooltip.re: Up to _%s blocks_ inside a cannon
item.createbigcannons.ram_rod.tooltip.su: Used for _manually loading a cannon_ instead of using the Cannon Loader contraption. _Consumes saturation and hunger points_, with more for every block pushed.
item.createbigcannons.timed_fuze.tooltip: Opens the _Set Timed Fuze_ menu, where the fuze duration can be set.
The fuze detonates after the projectile has been in the world for the set time.
Detonates after a _set time_ from launch.
item.createbigcannons.worm.tooltip.actio: Pulls munition blocks towards the end of the cannon. Can only pull one block at a time.
item.createbigcannons.worm.tooltip.reach: Up to _%s blocks_ inside a cannon
item.createbigcannons.worm.tooltip.summa: Used for _manually extracting munitions from a cannon_ instead of using the Cannon Loader Contraption. _Consumes saturation and hunger points._
